channel.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
channel.description: Hey Guys I would like to know if anyone out there who could make Soundpacks for Auxy and implement it on the Auxy App..... I know this is kind of wierd and odd question but even then I just wanna know

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Why all the “…”? It’s actually making … your posts … really … difficult to … read …

Regardless, if you have found a way that does not bypass the subscription system and does not allow users to simply sideload the premium presets, I’m all ears to hear how you did it. Even if it wouldn’t change the outcome, which would either be 1) developers shut down this entirely or 2) nothing happens because they’re ab absentium, I’m curious to see your solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
To be quite honest, I’m not really sure what to make of this. I’m hoping the developers, seeing that people really want to do this and are capable of it, will consider it. I doubt that will be the case, as it was made public and has brought about a lot of attention to is, and could potentially compromise their own system.

All in all, I’m sure it’s going to end poorly, and I’m not looking forward to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
El1011:

“You agree to comply with the following obligations and restrictions” … “not to make alterations to, or modifications of, the whole or any part of the App;”

I suppose I am guilty of breaking a previous version’s ToS in order to have made my demonstration, but as it was a version no longer used and for the purposes of demonstration I’d hopefully be fine, considering common sense. But legal issues are always muddy, not to mention costly, considering international law isn’t always consistent.

Regardless, I’d say this is a clear violation of the ToS. (I like saying regardless too much)

Read full topic

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Shivam:

By the way right now no one can bypass the Subscription Plan which is server based…

If you could possibly sideload your own sounds, what would prevent you from sideloading the subscription packs as well? Nothing could stop you, because those would be in the app from whatever sort of process you’ve used to get these sounds into the app. That would be bypassing it, therefore would be a loss of revenue for the developers. And wouldn’t be ethically sound.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Shivam:

That’s right unless it’s not shared or distributed publicly

Actually no, it’s not ok because you as the user are still bypassing the subscription plan by doing such a process.

It’s not ok even if it’s just one person, as that’s one loss of revenue.

…

Though, I finally do think this may actually prompt a response from the developers, but definitely not one that I, as someone who worked to balance out the process and make it less intrusive on their system, will find favorable to the idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Shivam:

Think of it … u can create your own sounds using serum like software’s then porting to ur app … wouldn’t it be nice the sound u want make it and implement it yourself … you don’t have to beg Dev for this and that sound

TheRealJFalc:

Auxy is a supported product, and modifying it could potentially lead to compromising the subscription system, which would be a clear violation of the ToS and be legally pursued. Which is not something anyone would want.

This is where the problem lies unfortunately. I have strong feelings about this, as for my demonstration I worked out a way to modify some custom sounds into an older version of Auxy to not break my own ethical standards by bypassing the subscription system. As Auxy currently stands, I do not see this as a good idea nor an ethical one, as it will lead people to potentially bypass the subscription, expediting the process of the death of Auxy.

Read full topic
